metadata.title: USN-5390-1 -- Linux kernel vulnerabilities
metadata.description: David Bouman discovered that the netfilter subsystem in the Linux kernel did not properly validate passed user register indices. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-1015)  David Bouman discovered that the netfilter subsystem in the Linux kernel did not initialize memory in some situations. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory). (CVE-2022-1016)  It was discovered that the ST21NFCA NFC driver in the Linux kernel did not properly validate the size of certain data in EVT_TRANSACTION events. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-26490)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5390-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-modules-extra-5.15.0-1003-gke - 5.15.0-1003.3 linux-gke-tools-5.15.0-1003 - 5.15.0-1003.3 linux-ibm-headers-5.15.0-1003 -
